snippet: States shouldn’t be allowed to register anonymous shell companies, which can be used for underground financing, tax evasion and other bad deeds.
abstract: Op-Ed article by John A Cassara, former Treasury Dept special agent, notes Delaware is most prominent among small group of states that register anonymous shell companies that can be used for underground financing, tax evasion and other criminal deeds; endorses proposal by Reps Maxine Waters and Carolyn B Maloney that would require all United States corporations to disclose their beneficial owners.
lead_paragraph: States shouldn’t be allowed to register anonymous shell companies, which can be used for underground financing, tax evasion and other bad deeds.
